alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:37PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pondera and central Teton Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 636 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Brady to near Choteau. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conrad, Choteau, Brady, Collins and Farmington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 315 and 342. Highway 287 near mile marker 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 28 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for north central Montana.
